item.title: A mattress has been dumped by the rubbish area, 23rd November
item.description:
Person was seen dumping the mattress in the rubbish area in front of 5 Havil Street on Saturday 22nd Nov just after 8.15pm. The individual does not reside in above block of flats and was seen dragging the mattress across on the property's CCTV recordings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havil Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danson Park small pond is still badly polluted, 23rd November
item.description:
The small pond has been in a disgusting state for several years - completely covered in green 'algae' and with a lot of rubbish thrown into it such as cans, bottles etc. Surely something can be done to fix this? Also, several times in the last year or so, contractors have planted shrubs on the path upto Danson House only for most of them to die.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish put the front of Jazzy pizza AGAIN, 23rd November
item.description:
Massive rubbish pile AGAIN! What’s the point in reporting this when it just is constant pile of rubbish there? It’s so gross and it’s honestly a hazard. Why are jazzy letting the rubbish build up there? I don’t want to eat at any of the restaurants here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 366-376, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: A Knife found. This is SERIOUS., 23rd November
item.description:
As per picture and my MANY other reports - flytipping continues to be a HUGE issue and it is not being taken seriously. The situation has suddenly gotten so much worse/more serious today. Someone had dumped a box of unwanted kitchen gear: chopping boards, Pot lids, etc. Amongst this box and strewn outside of the box in clear view, was a BLADE. A kitchen knife. See picture. This could have gotten into anyone's hands - a child, etc. This is entirely unacceptable. The disregard of people either living in the area, or that don't live here and flytip is a serious danger to the health and wellbeing of this estate. I have, as a concerned and courteous citizen, disposed of the knife, to avoid anything dangerous happening. But that does not solve the problem: the council needs to take this issue seriously. I am more than happy to be a part of the solution and be consulted, collaborated with, etc. Please take this seriously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kelsey Park Roundabout broken again, 23rd November
item.description:
The Kelsey Park roundabout in the children’s play area is broken again, just weeks after it was ‘fixed’ last time. It doesn’t spin freely and gets stuck.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ginkgo Tree fruit and large mess on pavements, 23rd November
item.description:
The Ginkgo tree situated outside this location on the pavement and road has extremely foul-smelling fruit which has fallen down and attracts pests and creates a messy, pungent odor likened to rotting butter or cheese. Female ginkgo trees produce a fruit that, when it falls and decomposes on the ground, creates a powerful, unpleasant odor. This needs to be cleaned up and the street power washed. It has been here for several weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous dog poop bags being dumped in the street., 23rd November
item.description:
For several months someone has been dumping green dog poop bags under trees along Bayston Road N16. Today 23.11.25, we counted approximately 19 green dog poop bags deposited by trees within a short distance along the north end of Bayston Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bayston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter in the hedge/road, 23rd November
item.description:
So much litter in the hedges (cans, bottles, plastic bags, a cap, the large plastic sheet that was taped to the ground by workmen outside what was Agora, now by the bin in Church Avenue and the general rubbish), would it be possible to remove it, please? Rubbish is also along the pavement and in the road. This rubbish also applies to the Crescent. Especially evident in the hedges, now the hedge has been cut back. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
